intro: Ludwigia tomentosa, commonly known as the velvetleaf waterweed, is a species of flowering plant in the family Onagraceae. It is native to parts of South America and is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage that gives it its common name. The plant typically grows in aquatic or semi-aquatic environments, such as ponds and slow-moving streams. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine, soft hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Ludwigia tomentosa produces small, yellowish flowers that are often borne in clusters, adding to its ornamental value in water gardens.
